title: Migrations and retention of religious beliefs

content.description: Many forced and free migrants practiced the religious beliefs of their homelands as a way of adapting to unfamiliar experiences and environments in their destination societies.
content.question: Which of the following processes best supports the historical argument above?

choices.label: African slaves in the Americas integrating African beliefs into their practice of Christianity
Japanese elites of the Tokugawa period encouraging the spread of Buddhism to promote cultural cohesion
Chinese migrant laborers in the United States converting to Christianity in order to better fit into the dominant culture
The indigenous rulers of Islamic states in Southeast Asia adapting aspects of Islam to local cultural and religious traditions

content.answer: African slaves in the Americas integrating African beliefs into their practice of Christianity

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
